snippet: Japan, a major holder of United States Treasury bonds, urged Washington to end a budget standoff and reach a deal on raising its debt ceiling to avoid a default.
abstract: Japanese Finance Min Taro Aso urges United States to avoid a default that could cast global economy into turmoil and hurt value of Japan’s enormous holdings of United States Treasury bonds; statement comes day after similar warnings from China, which has even larger stake in American debt.

byline.contributor: Edward Wong contributed reporting from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: Japan, a major holder of United States Treasury bonds, urged Washington to end a budget standoff and reach a deal on raising its debt ceiling to avoid a default.

headline.main: U.S. Warned by Japanese Over Perils of a Default
headline.print_headline: U.S. Warned By Japanese Over Perils Of a Default
